channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9457] Master could fail start if region server with system table is down
item.description: In the region server holding the system table is killed while master is starting, master will hang there waiting for system table to be assigned which won't happen.
item.summary: Master could fail start if region server with system table is down

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Francis Liu, Stack, is there any special reason we need to assign system tables before user tables? In case user tables depend on some system tables in the future? I don't see a system table server shutdown handler, so I assume user tables don't depend on system table for normal operations. At least user region assignment doesn't need system table to be available? If so, can we assign system tables together with user tables? For example, the access control table is assigned just like another user table.

Jimmy Xiang That would be good if we could get away w/ that. In the past we had a 'historian' table into which we wrote all cluster events. We used to have interesting issues where the historian was not available when user tables were trying to report they were splitting or closing so we used to try and ensure it was opened first and closed last. If we were to do the same thing today – or have a metrics system table – then we'd want it up always and up before user tables came on line... but maybe that is too hard to ensure? And maybe stepped assign is for post 0.96? i.e. we should undo the special casing of namespace system table? Francis Liu?

Yes, it is hard to ensure that, especially when those region server recovery cases are considered, even harder if log replay is considered.

To undo the special namespace system table assignment, we need to change how namespace is initialized. Currently ZKNamespaceManager can be initiated only after the namespace table is assigned. However ZKNamespaceManager is not used any where. If we are ok to (1) put ZKNamespaceManager aisde for now or just remove it, (2) initiate TableNamespaceManager lazily only when it is needed, then we can undo it.

is there any special reason we need to assign system tables before user tables?

The main driving use case are the namespace table and the metrics table. The namespace jira superceded the systems table jira (HBASE-7999) which was a subtask for a metrics table (HBASE-7958). Jesse Yates care to chime in?

However ZKNamespaceManager is not used any where.

It's used by HBASE-8410

Yes, it is hard to ensure that, especially when those region server recovery cases are considered, even harder if log replay is considered.

Don't we have simliar problems with meta? Maybe we can solve it the same way?

The main driving use case are the namespace table and the metrics table. The namespace jira superceded the systems table jira (HBASE-7999) which was a subtask for a metrics table (HBASE-7958). Jesse Yates care to chime in?

With metrics, you need to make sure the metrics table was present before you could be sure the metrics would actually be collected for the primary/user table. I would imagine the same logic should apply to the security (ACL) table as well. For metrics, we could drop/buffer info until the table came online, but wouldn't necessarily work for security.

For security, the ACL table is assigned just like a user table. It is scanned when it is needed. If anything is wrong, the operation is retried. So we don't need it to be available all the time. It is better to be assigned asap, but it is not mandated. So the master can start up with no problem if the region server holding ACL dies at this moment.

Don't we have simliar problems with meta? Maybe we can solve it the same way?

For meta, we split meta log for all previouslyFailedServers if log replay is enabled. We don't want to split log for all failed servers before we say system table is assigned. For meta, we have meta server shutdown handler to assign meta again so other regions can be assigned. If during master restarts, the sever holding a system is dead, we need to specially handle it otherwise the system table won't be available.
Seems reasonable.

For security, the ACL table is assigned just like a user table. It is scanned when it is needed. If anything is wrong, the operation is retried. So we don't need it to be available all the time. It is better to be assigned asap, but it is not mandated. So the master can start up with no problem if the region server holding ACL dies at this moment.

To be more accurate ACL table is able to do this because it mirrors all it's data in ZK. All reads go through ZK but updates are done on the table itself. And ACL write commands are invoked by a users so failures will be reflected back to the user so he can try again. While from the perspective of a metrics table, updates will be done by the system itself so retries have a different effect on the system. Which may be unacceptable in some scenarios?

For meta, we split meta log for all previouslyFailedServers if log replay is enabled. We don't want to split log for all failed servers before we say system table is assigned. For meta, we have meta server shutdown handler to assign meta again so other regions can be assigned.

This is what I was planning HBASE-9148, will address. Essentially have a system wal and the necessary mechanisms to support it server shutdown handler, open region handler, etc. Does that work for you?

If during master restarts, the sever holding a system is dead, we need to specially handle it otherwise the system table won't be available.

I essentially copied the assign meta logic for assign system tables. I didn't see this logic for meta. Or did I miss that?

perspective of a metrics table, updates will be done by the system itself so retries have a different effect on the system. Which may be unacceptable in some scenarios?

IMO, we can lose some stats - they are a best effort and its ok if they are off by a bit (this may be revised later, but that's generally the way people approach stats). I'd say lets go with the expected behavior for startup, esp if Jimmy is gonna do the work , and change it back later if we need to.

I see, thanks for that insight.

I'd be happy to do the work if we decide to go with this route.

So that leaves just the namespace table then. Would it be feasible to at least have the namespace table use the meta wal? I think we should have the namespace table as accessible as the meta table to make sure namespaces (and it's meta information) are first class. Thoughts?
Francis Liu That sounds right but as per Jimmy Xiang there is a bunch of work to do ensuring ns gets same treatment as meta.
I can take a stab at doing the work and post something tomorrow. If it can't wait then we can just roll things back and add the feature in 0.98.
Though that would mean HBASE-8410 as it stands would only be available in 0.98 as well.
Let me work out a patch at first. Then we can discuss how to move ahead.

Added a patch that assigns system table together with user tables. Added more comments and optimized the meta assignment and SSH enabling a little. Changed namespace manager start() so that it has at most 1 minute now. If it is assigned in 1 minute it is initiated, otherwise, it will be initiated on demand. Not started namespace janitor any more. We can add it back later on if need. However, to me, it should be removed since (1) it could race with namespace manager, i.e. some newly added namespace manager could be removed by the janitor as an orphan, (2), namespace manager seems to be a better place to clean up namespace, may need a delete command in namespace manager. Also fixed a failover detection issue in AM.

This message is automatically generated.

The findbugs issue was because of oom. Francis Liu, are we ok with the namespace related changes? It is listed here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-9457?focusedCommentId=13763744&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13763744
Jimmy Xiang No time today will take a look tomorrow.
+1 on removing special casing of system table assign till better thought through. Patch looks good.
Attached v2.2, rebased to trunk latest.

Looked at the patch. It seems the zk namespace data gets stale with this approach. Since the namespace table is lazily loaded, this causes the namespace zk information to be lazily loaded as well. Which causes the data read by zkNM clients to be stale until one of the namespace apis are invoked which seems to be unbounded.

I think there are two other options:

1. move zkNM to a region observer coprocessor
2. roll namespace table into the meta handler classes (metaWAL, metaSSH, etc)

If time is a concern we can just remove zkNM and address it in a separate jira.

Good catch on the race condition with the janitor. I'll address that in HBASE-9540.
Francis Liu I take that as a +1. If HBASE-9540 gets addressed before 0.96.0, well-and-good, else, fix can come in after.

I'm +1. Tho I'm wondering are there any backwards compatibility gotchas if when we move namespace table from one wal to another? It seems we could just flush the namespace table and perform rolling restart to do an upgrade.
stab at moving namespace table to use meta wal. wanted to understand the LOE and pieces involved.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
